head.supplied: [Cambewarra, 21 June 1888] ¶ ¶ [...] ¶ ¶ 60a and 60b are of a tree which I have never seen before, and which is not known here; it seems to be a hybrid between Euc. corymbosa and Euc. maculata, ther...

div.p: MRS 203/1 special bundle, collector, Archives of the Museum of Applied Arts and Sciences, Ultimo, New South Wales.

60a and 60b are of a tree which I have never seen before, and which is not known here; it seems to be a hybrid between Euc. corymbosa and Euc. maculata, therefore I have forwarded two logs, one from the lower trunk with sealy bark, and one from the upper with smooth bark. I have also forwarded two bundles of bark. As I sent complete material (buds, flower and fruit) to Baron von Müller some time ago, I was in hopes to be able to give the name of the species when I send the logs, but I have not heard from the Baron for some weeks now, though I have sent material and letters twice since. As soon as I hear about the tree, I will send you full particulars, provided of course that the tree proves anything uncommon at all [...]

Nro. 63 is variously named and in appearance rather perplexing, therefore I want to send the material of it to Baron von Müller first, along with material of two other species, which resemble it much, but the fruit of which is different [...]
